answers.text:
Hey Pamela,
The 2006 issue of Public Management put out an article on this subject called, "How Do I Get New Council Members Up To Speed?"  It shares perspectives from three managers who discuss what works for them in orienting newly elected officials:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3282/How_Do_I_Get_New_Council_Members_Up_to_Speed
We also have a handout archived from ICMA's Annual Conference in 2006.  It comes from a panel discussion on tools for helping elected officials be effective colleagues in creating community policy:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6253/Elected_Officials_Effective_Officials
This article describes how Billings, MT uses the time between election and seating to prepare their elected officials for duty:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6827/Seven_Precious_Weeks
And this document summarizes several plans for elected official orientation:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4891/Commentary_Highlights_of_Local_Government_Orientation_Plans
Hope these help,
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA
